trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> objects.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttributes> class allows you to specify the derived types that can be inserted into an array returned by a public field or public read/write property.
An instance of this class is returned by the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributes.XmlArrayItems%2A> property of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributes> class.

The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributes> class is used when overriding the set of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute> objects that can be inserted into an array to which the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayAttribute> has been applied.

For each new type you want the field or property to accept, create an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute> and use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttributes.Add%2A> to add the object to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttributes> collection returned by the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributes.XmlArrayItems%2A> property.

<xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributeOverrides.Add%2A> the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributes> to an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributeOverrides>, that specifies the type of the object that contains the field or property, and the name of the field or property.

Construct an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> with the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributeOverrides> before calling the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Serialize%2A> or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttributes"></xref> class.
Adds an <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> to add to the collection.
The index of the added item.
Determines whether the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> to check for.
`true` if the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Copies an <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> array to the collection, starting at a specified target index.
The array of <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> objects to copy to the collection.
The index at which the copied attributes begin.

Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> in the collection or -1 if the attribute is not found in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The first index of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> in the collection or -1 if the attribute is not found in the collection.
Inserts an <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> into the collection at the specified index.
The index at which the attribute is inserted.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> to insert.
Gets or sets the item at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the collection member to get or set.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> at the specified index.
Removes an <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> from the collection, if it is present.
The implementation of this is the same as the <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList.Remove%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayItemAttribute"></xref> to remove.
